member.name: T:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Capture
member.summary: Represents the results from a single successful subexpression capture.

member.name: P:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Capture.Index
member.summary: The position in the original string where the first character of the captured substring is found.
member.returns: The zero-based starting position in the original string where the captured substring is found.

member.name: P:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Capture.Length
member.summary: Gets the length of the captured substring.
member.returns: The length of the captured substring.

member.name: M:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Capture.ToString
member.summary: Retrieves the captured substring from the input string by calling the property.
member.returns: The substring that was captured by the match.

member.name: P:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Capture.Value
member.summary: Gets the captured substring from the input string.
member.returns: The substring that is captured by the match.

member.name: T:System.Text.RegularExpressions.CaptureCollection
member.summary: Represents the set of captures made by a single capturing group.

member.name: P:System.Text.RegularExpressions.CaptureCollection.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of substrings captured by the group.
member.returns: The number of items in the .

member.summary: Provides an enumerator that iterates through the collection.
member.returns: An object that contains all objects within the .

member.name: P:System.Text.RegularExpressions.CaptureCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets an individual member of the collection.
member.returns: The captured substring at position in the collection.
member.param: Index into the capture collection.
member.exception: is less than 0 or greater than .

member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether access to the collection is synchronized (thread-safe).
member.returns: false in all cases.

member.summary: Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.

member.name: T:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Group
member.summary: Represents the results from a single capturing group.

member.name: P:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Group.Captures
member.summary: Gets a collection of all the captures matched by the capturing group, in innermost-leftmost-first order (or innermost-rightmost-first order if the regular expression is modified with the option). The collection may have zero or more items.
member.returns: The collection of substrings matched by the group.

member.name: P:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Group.Success
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the match is successful.
member.returns: true if the match is successful; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:System.Text.RegularExpressions.GroupCollection
member.summary: Returns the set of captured groups in a single match.

member.summary: Returns the number of groups in the collection.
member.returns: The number of groups in the collection.

member.name: T:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Match
member.summary: Represents the results from a single regular expression match.

member.name: P:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Match.Empty
member.summary: Gets the empty group. All failed matches return this empty match.
member.returns: An empty match.

member.name: P:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Match.Groups
member.summary: Gets a collection of groups matched by the regular expression.
member.returns: The character groups matched by the pattern.

member.name: M:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Match.NextMatch
member.summary: Returns a new object with the results for the next match, starting at the position at which the last match ended (at the character after the last matched character).
member.returns: The next regular expression match.
member.exception: A time-out occurred.

member.name: M:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Match.Result(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the expansion of the specified replacement pattern.
member.returns: The expanded version of the parameter.
member.param: The replacement pattern to use.
member.exception: is null.
Expansion is not allowed for this pattern.

member.name: T:System.Text.RegularExpressions.MatchCollection
member.summary: Represents the set of successful matches found by iteratively applying a regular expression pattern to the input string.

member.summary: Gets the number of matches.
member.returns: The number of matches.
member.exception: A time-out occurred.

member.name: T:System.Text.RegularExpressions.MatchEvaluator
member.summary: Represents the method that is called each time a regular expression match is found during a method operation.
member.returns: A string returned by the method that is represented by the delegate.
member.param: The object that represents a single regular expression match during a method operation.

member.name: M:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex.#ctor(System.String,System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class for the specified regular expression, with options that modify the pattern and a value that specifies how long a pattern matching method should attempt a match before it times out.
member.param: The regular expression pattern to match.
A bitwise combination of the enumeration values that modify the regular expression.
A time-out interval, or to indicate that the method should not time out.

is null.
is not a valid value.-or- is negative, zero, or greater than approximately 24 days.

member.name: P:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex.CacheSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of entries in the current static cache of compiled regular expressions.
member.returns: The maximum number of entries in the static cache.
member.exception: The value in a set operation is less than zero.

member.name: M:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex.Escape(System.String)
member.summary: Escapes a minimal set of characters (\, *, +, ?, |, {, [, (,), ^, $,., #, and white space) by replacing them with their escape codes. This instructs the regular expression engine to interpret these characters literally rather than as metacharacters.
member.returns: A string of characters with metacharacters converted to their escaped form.
member.param: The input string that contains the text to convert.
member.exception: is null.

member.name: M:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex.GetGroupNames
member.summary: Returns an array of capturing group names for the regular expression.
member.returns: A string array of group names.

member.name: M:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex.GetGroupNumbers
member.summary: Returns an array of capturing group numbers that correspond to group names in an array.
member.returns: An integer array of group numbers.

member.name: M:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex.GroupNameFromNumber(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the group name that corresponds to the specified group number.
member.returns: A string that contains the group name associated with the specified group number. If there is no group name that corresponds to , the method returns .
member.param: The group number to convert to the corresponding group name.

member.name: M:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex.GroupNumberFromName(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the group number that corresponds to the specified group name.
member.returns: The group number that corresponds to the specified group name, or -1 if is not a valid group name.
member.param: The group name to convert to the corresponding group number.
member.exception: is null.

member.name: M:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex.Replace(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: In a specified input string, replaces all strings that match a regular expression pattern with a specified replacement string.
member.returns: A new string that is identical to the input string, except that the replacement string takes the place of each matched string. If the regular expression pattern is not matched in the current instance, the method returns the current instance unchanged.
member.param: The string to search for a match.
The replacement string.
member.exception: or is null.

member.name: T:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexMatchTimeoutException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the execution time of a regular expression pattern-matching method exceeds its time-out interval.

member.name: M:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexMatchTimeoutException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a system-supplied message.

member.name: M:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexMatchTimeoutException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified message string.
member.param: A string that describes the exception.

member.name: M:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexMatchTimeoutException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: A string that describes the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception.

member.name: M:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexMatchTimeoutException.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with information about the regular expression pattern, the input text, and the time-out interval.
member.param: The input text processed by the regular expression engine when the time-out occurred.
The pattern used by the regular expression engine when the time-out occurred.
The time-out interval.

member.name: P:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexMatchTimeoutException.Input
member.summary: Gets the input text that the regular expression engine was processing when the time-out occurred.
member.returns: The regular expression input text.

member.name: P:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexMatchTimeoutException.MatchTimeout
member.summary: Gets the time-out interval for a regular expression match.
member.returns: The time-out interval.

member.name: P:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexMatchTimeoutException.Pattern
member.summary: Gets the regular expression pattern that was used in the matching operation when the time-out occurred.
member.returns: The regular expression pattern.

member.name: T:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions
member.summary: Provides enumerated values to use to set regular expression options.

member.name: F:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions.Compiled
member.summary: Specifies that the regular expression is compiled to an assembly. This yields faster execution but increases startup time. This value should not be assigned to the property when calling the method. For more information, see the "Compiled Regular Expressions" section in the Regular Expression Options topic.

member.name: F:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions.CultureInvariant
member.summary: Specifies that cultural differences in language is ignored. For more information, see the "Comparison Using the Invariant Culture" section in the Regular Expression Options topic.

member.name: F:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions.ECMAScript
member.summary: Enables ECMAScript-compliant behavior for the expression. This value can be used only in conjunction with the , , and values. The use of this value with any other values results in an exception.For more information on the option, see the "ECMAScript Matching Behavior" section in the Regular Expression Options topic.

member.name: F:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions.ExplicitCapture
member.summary: Specifies that the only valid captures are explicitly named or numbered groups of the form (?<name>…). This allows unnamed parentheses to act as noncapturing groups without the syntactic clumsiness of the expression (?:…). For more information, see the "Explicit Captures Only" section in the Regular Expression Options topic.

member.name: F:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions.IgnoreCase
member.summary: Specifies case-insensitive matching. For more information, see the "Case-Insensitive Matching " section in the Regular Expression Options topic.

member.name: F:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions.IgnorePatternWhitespace
member.summary: Eliminates unescaped white space from the pattern and enables comments marked with #. However, this value does not affect or eliminate white space in character classes, numeric quantifiers, or tokens that mark the beginning of individual regular expression language elements. For more information, see the "Ignore White Space" section of the Regular Expression Options topic.

member.name: F:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions.Multiline
member.summary: Multiline mode. Changes the meaning of ^ and $ so they match at the beginning and end, respectively, of any line, and not just the beginning and end of the entire string. For more information, see the "Multiline Mode" section in the Regular Expression Options topic.

member.name: F:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions.None
member.summary: Specifies that no options are set. For more information about the default behavior of the regular expression engine, see the "Default Options" section in the Regular Expression Options topic.

member.name: F:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions.RightToLeft
member.summary: Specifies that the search will be from right to left instead of from left to right. For more information, see the "Right-to-Left Mode" section in the Regular Expression Options topic.

member.name: F:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions.Singleline
member.summary: Specifies single-line mode. Changes the meaning of the dot (.) so it matches every character (instead of every character except \n). For more information, see the "Single-line Mode" section in the Regular Expression Options topic.
